column1: Aghan was one of the Drúedain who lived in the region of the Forest of Brethil during the First Age. He was skilled in the healing of wounds
column2: and had special knowledge of the venoms used by Orcs.

column1: At a time of Orc-raids in the woods of Brethil
column2: he took to watching the home of his friend Barach of the House of Haleth. According to the tale of The Faithful Stone
column3: he was called away from Barachs house for some days to help his injured kin
column4: and left behind a "watch-stone": a figure carved in the shape of a Drúedain. While he was away
column5: Barachs house was attacked by Orcs who attempted to set it ablaze
column6: but they were beaten off by a mysterious Drúedain.

column1: Barach afterwards discovered that it was the watch-stone itself that had somehow come to life and saved his family from the Orcs
column2: though it had been badly burned and broken in putting out the flames. Because of the power Aghan had put into the stone
column3: he too suffered some of these burns
column4: though they were already healing when he returned to Barachs house the following day.
